byline.contributor: Cooper Neill reported from Garland, Richard Pérez-Peña from New York, and David Montgomery from Austin, Tex.
byline.original: By COOPER NEILL, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and DAVID MONTGOMERY

abstract: Neighborhoods outside Dallas suffer deadliest tornado system in 88 years, resulting in at least 11 deaths and mass destruction of homes; Dallas County declares state of disaster.
lead_paragraph: At least 11 people were killed, the most in the area in 88 years, and hundreds of homes were damaged or destroyed in suburban neighborhoods.

headline.main: Near Dallas, Residents Tally Tornadoes’ Devastation
headline.print_headline: Tallying Devastation in Tornadoes Near Dallas

snippet: At least 11 people were killed, the most in the area in 88 years, and hundreds of homes were damaged or destroyed in suburban neighborhoods.
